Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (mostly worn); exterior part of two black bands and pre-firing inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1597) (phase 2)
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (24, fig. 3)
